args.natural_language_statement: Let n ≥ 2. Prove that S_n is generated by the set of adjacent transpositions {(1,2),(2,3),…, (n-1,n)}. Translate into Lean4 (statement only, no proof) and end with := by sorry.

result:
{"ok": true, "lean_translation": "import Mathlib
open Equiv Function Fintype Finset

/-- Let n ≥ 2. Prove that S_n is generated by the set of adjacent transpositions {(1,2),(2,3),…, (n-1,n)}. Translate into Lean4 (statement only, no proof) and end with := by sorry. -/
theorem mclosure_swap_castSucc_succ (n : ℕ) [n.AtLeastTwo] :
    Submonoid.closure (Set.range fun i : Fin n => swap i.castSucc i.succ) = ⊤ := sorry"}

args.content:
import Mathlib

/-- The symmetric group S_n (permutations of Fin n) is generated by the adjacent
    transpositions (i, i+1) for i = 0,..,n-2, when n ≥ 2. -/
theorem symmetric_group_generated_by_adjacent_transpositions (n : ℕ) (h : 2 ≤ n) :
  Subgroup.closure (Set.range (fun i : Fin (n - 1) => Equiv.swap (Fin.castSucc i) (i.succ))) =
    (⊤ : Subgroup (Equiv.Perm (Fin n))) := by sorry

import Mathlib

/-- The symmetric group S_n (permutations of Fin n) is generated by the adjacent
    transpositions (i, i+1) for i = 0,..,n-2, when n ≥ 2. -/
theorem symmetric_group_generated_by_adjacent_transpositions (n : ℕ) (h : 2 ≤ n) :
  Subgroup.closure (Set.range (fun i : Fin (n - 1) => Equiv.swap (Fin.castSucc i) (i.succ))) =
    (⊤ : Subgroup (Equiv.Perm (Fin (n - 1 + 1)))) := by sorry
